column2: The Assistant Professor in Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation (PM&R) is a crucial academic role within the Department of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation, responsible for medical education, patient care, research, and contributions to the field of PM&R        Responsibilities:        Deliver lectures, seminars, and hands-on training to medical students, residents, and fellows in Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation      Participate in curriculum development and updates, integrating the latest advancements in PM&R      Provide clinical supervision and mentorship to medical trainees during their PM&R rotations      Evaluate and treat patients with physical disabilities, musculoskeletal disorders, and neurological conditions      Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to develop comprehensive rehabilitation plans      Participate in clinical rounds, case discussions, and contribute to medical decision-making      Engage in PM&R research activities, designing studies, collecting and analyzing data, and interpreting results      Publish research findings in reputable medical journals and present at academic conferences      Contribute to the development of grant proposals and funding applications for PM&R research      Stay updated on emerging treatment techniques, technologies, and protocols in PM&R      Uphold ethical standards and patient safety in all clinical and research activities      Contribute to departmental initiatives, quality improvement projects, and policy development        Requirements:        Medical degree (MD) and board certification or eligibility for board certification in Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation      Clinical experience in PM&R practice      Strong interest in medical education and teaching      Effective communication and presentation skills      Track record of research activities in Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation      Published research in reputable medical journals      Proficiency in medical research methodologies and analysis tools      Commitment to ethical medical practice and patient safety      Participation in professional organizations and networks      Active involvement in medical conferences and continuing education
column11: Quality improvement, Data analysis, Associate Professor, Curriculum development, Patient care, Assistant Professor, Ophthalmology, Research, Supervision, Teaching

column2: The Associate Professor in Ophthalmology is a senior academic position within the Department of Ophthalmology, responsible for advancing medical education, conducting research, providing patient care, and contributing to the field of Ophthalmology        Responsibilities:        Deliver advanced lectures, seminars, and practical training to medical students, residents, and fellows in Ophthalmology      Contribute to curriculum development and updates, integrating the latest advancements in ophthalmic practice      Mentor and guide junior faculty, residents, and trainees in their ophthalmology education and training      Diagnose and treat complex ophthalmic conditions, including refractive errors, glaucoma, cataracts, and retinal diseases      Perform ophthalmic surgeries, such as cataract extraction, corneal transplantation, and retinal procedures      Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to provide comprehensive and patient-centered eye care      Engage in ophthalmic research activities, designing studies, collecting and analyzing data, and interpreting results      Publish research findings in reputable ophthalmology journals and present at academic conferences      Contribute to the development of grant proposals and funding applications for ophthalmology research      Stay updated on emerging technologies, treatment modalities, and protocols in Ophthalmology      Uphold ethical standards and patient safety in all clinical and research activities      Provide clinical leadership and guidance for ophthalmology treatment programs      Contribute to departmental initiatives, quality improvement projects, and policy development      Requirements:Medical degree (MD) and board certification in Ophthalmology      Proven clinical experience in Ophthalmology practice      Strong commitment to medical education and teaching      Extensive research experience and published works in Ophthalmology      Proficiency in ophthalmology research methodologies and analysis tools      Effective communication and presentation skills      Leadership abilities and mentoring experience      Dedication to ethical medical practice and patient safety      Active involvement in ophthalmology organizations and networks      Participation in ophthalmology conferences and continuing education

column2: Greetings from Aakash Healthcare Looking for Senior Resident / Attending / Associate Consultant - Ophthalmology at Aakash Healthcare Dwarka , New Delhi Ophthalmologist Job Description Template We are looking for a knowledgeable ophthalmologist to be responsible for repairing traumatic eye injuries, diagnosing eye ailments, and prescribing medications. The ophthalmologist's responsibilities range from simple duties, such as prescribing corrective lenses, to performing highly advanced duties, such as keyhole or laser surgery. An ophthalmologist can choose to specialize in one area of eye care, such as treating children's eyes as a pediatric ophthalmologist. To be a successful ophthalmologist, you should be willing to maintain up-to-date knowledge of the diseases, functions, and anatomy of the eye. You should be meticulous, analytical, and have very steady hands. Ophthalmologist Responsibilities: Providing routine care such as vision testing and prescribing glasses and contact lenses. Performing corrective surgeries, such as repairing injuries and corneas, and removing cataracts. Performing advanced surgical procedures, such as keyhole or laser surgery. Diagnosing and treating eye diseases and injuries. Managing emergency eye clinics, outpatient clinics, or other specialist eye clinics. Treating medical disorders that affect the vision through a holistic approach. Using therapeutic procedures and performing biopsies. Qualification- MS/MD/DNB in Opthalmology Exp- 1-8yrs Interested candidates can share their profile on nitin.yadav@aakashhealthcare.com or contact at 8447525073
column11: Ophthalmology, Eye

column2: Sankara Eye Hospital is looking for Consultant Vitreo Retina & Paediatric Ophthalmology to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey. column2: DOCTORS DOOR  is looking for SURGICAL RETINA OPHTHALMOLOGIST  to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey    Retinal Detachment Repair: Surgical Retina Ophthalmologists perform surgeries to reattach a detached retina, a serious condition that can lead to vision loss if not promptly treated      Macular Hole and Pucker Repair: They perform procedures to repair macular holes and epiretinal membranes (wrinkles on the retina) that can distort vision      Vitreoretinal Surgery: These specialists perform vitrectomy surgery, a procedure to remove the vitreous gel inside the eye, often used to treat conditions like diabetic retinopathy, macular degeneration, and retinal tears      Diabetic Retinopathy Treatment: Surgical Retina Ophthalmologists may use laser surgery or other techniques to manage complications of diabetic retinopathy, such as bleeding or abnormal blood vessels in the retina      Retinopathy of Prematurity Treatment: They treat retinal abnormalities in premature infants that can lead to vision impairment or blindness      Intraocular Foreign Body Removal: They may perform surgeries to remove foreign objects that have entered the eye and are affecting the retina      Complex Retinal Surgeries: These specialists address complex cases involving trauma, tumors, and other conditions that affect the retina      Intravitreal Injections: Surgical Retina Ophthalmologists administer intravitreal injections of medications, such as anti-VEGF agents, to manage conditions like age-related macular degeneration and retinal vein occlusions      Research and Innovation: They may engage in research to advance surgical techniques and treatment options in the field of surgical retina
